features: COMPARABLE TO U.S. SIMILAC PRO-ADVANCE: This formula was manufactured in Ireland and is similar to the U.S. version of Similac Pro-Advance
FORMULA PREPARATION: Mix 1 scoop of formula per 2 fl oz (60 mL) of water
IMMUNE SUPPORT: Features 2’-FL HMO and nucleotides to help support your baby’s immune system
MEETS THE U.S. FDA’s CRITERIA: This product meets the U.S. FDA’s criteria for temporarily allowing formulas manufactured outside the U.S. for import
body.description: Similac Infant Formula with 2’-FL HMO is comparable to the U.S. version of Similac Pro-Advance. Similac Infant Formula with 2’-FL HMO and nucleotides helps support baby’s immune system. This product was manufactured in Ireland. Abbott Nutrition has worked with the FDA to import this product to help with supply chain shortages. Because every baby’s tummy is unique, it can be difficult to predict how each baby will tolerate a formula change. It’s always best to talk to your pediatrician before making formula changes.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Why is the bottle preparation for the imported Similac Infant Formula “1 scoop to 60 mL water”? This formula has been imported from Ireland. As such, the label measurements use the metric system. 60 mL is equivalent to 2 fl oz of water, which is similar to the typical preparation instructions for making a bottle. 1 scoop per 2 fl oz of water. If I have questions about formula imported by Abbott, should I call the number on the container or use the email on the container? For more information, contact our Similac Feeding Expert team at 800-986-8800, Monday through Friday, 8:30 AM to 7 PM EST. Why do the directions call for boiling water for this product? It’s always best to prepare according to label instructions. Some countries recommend boiling water for 2 or 5 minutes. Ask your baby’s doctor if you need to use cooled, boiled water for mixing, and if you need to boil (sterilize) bottles, nipples, and rings before use. What does “EyeQ Plus” and “AA” mean on the label? EyeQ Plus may appear on some labels and references key nutrients for brain development, including DHA and AA (which means arachidonic acid, sometimes abbreviated as ARA). What does “Stage 1, 0-12 months” mean on the label? “Stage 1, 0-12 months” means the formula is appropriate for use from birth until 12 months of age.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What a difference!!
reviews.reviewText: My baby kept rejecting any formula we offered. She would drink because she was hungry but constantly pull away from bottle and cry. Due to sale I tried 1 can. Guess what she never did that with this formula! She drinks it just fine, no spit up issues, no tummy issues. Now we have her so spoiled on this if we run out before more is in she gets extra hangry. I don't know why it's so different from the US but it's a win in my book.The lid is just an added bonus. It's a lot like our Sam's club formula lid scoop stay in the lid, lid snaps close. I get so many comments how nice my formula containers are.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Imported, European version of American Similac Pro Advance. I love the lid design on these cans. Has a good seal for freshness and doesn’t spill. The scoop snaps into the top of the lid for storage so you don’t have to dig it out of the formula. Only down side is the scoop lip is wider than the base of the scoop so it makes half scoops a little tricky. Still five stars though cause my son does so well on this formula.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Baby said yum yum

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love the sale on this and will get multiple cans. My daughter LOVES it! She has zero issues with it and it dose not upset her belly. Will keep buying!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I got a super deal and it was very cheap
reviews.reviewText: Glad that my little one like it. He does not reject it. You need to just buy one and see whether you child likes it or not

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Baby likes it
reviews.reviewText: I bought it when it was on sale and for the price, quality is great. Baby liked it and I reordered it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Please don’t mistake this for the blue advanced option
reviews.reviewText: Holy heck. My not sensitive baby was so backed up on this. Severe constipation, so many tears and just down right a terrible time for everyone involved. She’s had every formula and has never had issues except with this one. I bought this as we where going on a trip and figured blue Similac was similar to the old blue stuff just rebranded. WRONG! Good luck!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My baby's favorite formula
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Up until about 7 months old, my baby was exclusively breastfed but at that point I just could not keep up with her demand and had to supplement. We tried multiple formulas before this, all of which I've had to mix with pumped milk in order for her to drink. This is the 1st one that she actually enjoys drinking and will gladly drink full bottles. I like the clip for the scoop in the lid, however I with there was an easier way to level the product in the can. The video shows after a few weeks of use. Overall, we are very pleased!
